_header: Undo thy door my spouse dear
Subjects: Christ, appeal of, to man; dialogues, Christ and man; translations
_description: ‘Ecce sto ad hostium et pulso’, Appeal of Christ to his leman and the reply — two 6-line stanzas and five couplets

NLS18721.First Lines:
Vndo þi dore my spuse dereAllas wy stond i loken out
                    here…
NLS18721.Last Lines:
…womman Jon i take to þeIn stede of me þi sone to be
                    Amen
NLS18721.Note:
In John Grimestone’s sermon notebook, translating ‘Caput
                        meum plenum est rore’ (Canticum 5); ‘Ecce sto ad hostium
                        et pulso’ (Apocalypsis 3) which precedes it; 2 6-line stanzas and
                    6 couplets. ‘Responsio peccatoris’ in margin at ln.
                    7.
